jurls.reinforcementlearning.domains.arcade.agents

Class AbstractAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • jurls.reinforcementlearning.domains.arcade.agents.AbstractAgent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HumanAgent, RLAgent

    public abstract class AbstractAgent
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract agent class. New agents can be created by extending this class and implementing its abstract methods.
    Author:
    Marc G. Bellemare

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected ScreenConverter converter
      Used to convert ALE screen data to GUI images

      If non-null, we communicate via named pipes rather than stdin/stdout
      protected AbstractUI ui
      The UI used for displaying images and receiving actions
      protected boolean useGUI
      Whether to use a GUI

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractAgent

        public AbstractAgent(boolean useGUI,
                     java.lang.String namedPipesBasename)
        Create a new agent with the specified parameters. The user can specify the base name for two FIFO pipes used to communicate with ALE. If namedPipesBasename is not null, then the files namedPipesBasename+"_in" and namedPipesBasename+"_out" are read and written to by the agent. See ALE documentation for more details on running with named pipes.
        Parameters:
        useGUI - If true, a GUI is used to display received screen data.
        namedPipesBasename - If non-null, the base filename for the two FIFO files used to communicate with ALE.

      • AbstractAgent

        public AbstractAgent()

    • Method Detail

      • init

        protected void init(boolean useGUI,
                    java.lang.String namedPipesBasename)

      • makePalette

        protected final ColorPalette makePalette(java.lang.String paletteName)
        Create a color palette used to display the screen. The currently available choices are NTSC (128 colors) and SECAM (8 colors).
        Parameters:
        paletteName - The name of the palette (NTSC or SECAM).
        Returns:

      • init

        public final void init()
        Initialize relevant bits of the agent

      • initIO

        protected void initIO()
        Initialize the I/O object for this agent.

      • run

        public void run()
        The main program loop. In turn, we will obtain a new screen from ALE, pass it on to the agent and send back an action (which may be a reset request).

      • updateImage

        protected void updateImage(ScreenMatrix currentScreen)
